1.heading: Seibâ Marionetto J. English.
1.title: Saber Marionette J
1.author: written by Satoru Akahori ; art by Yumisuke Kotoyoshi ; Jeremiah Bourque, translator.
notes: Translation of: Seibâ Marionetto J.
"First published in Japan in 1997 by Kadokawa Shoten."

Summary (from OCLC): On a world with no women, the surviving men have reinvented females in the form of androids called Marionettes. Normal marionettes are built to serve men and are limited in their actions and emotions until a boy named Otaru Mamiya finds a special Saber Marionette named Lime.

25.title: Das Seidenband
25.author: Hannes Nüsseler.
notes: "Kaiser Napoleon Bonaparte verfügte 1806 eine Kontinentalsperre über Grossbritanien, um die Briten in die Knie zu zwingen. Die Folge waren Schmuggel und Geschäfte im hablegalen Bereich, bei denen sich under anderem Basler Handelsleute grosse Gewinne sicherten. Um diesen das Handwerk to legen, schickt Paris einen Gesandten nach Basel, der die Geschäfte der Kaufleute Blanc Père et Fils & Cie ausspionieren soll. Eines Nachts verlässt eine geheimnisvolle schwarze Kutsche das Blanc'sche Anwesen. Der Gesandte macht sich auf ihre Spur und entdeckt ein schauerliches Geheimnis. Das Aufkommen der Textilindustrie in der Region Basel und deren Finanzierung bilden den Hintergrund für diese spannende Geschichte."

161.author: Si Spencer, writer ; Simon Gane, penciller ; Cameron Stewart, Ryan Kelly, inkers ; Guy Major, colorist ; Jared K
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
(Vertigo)
"Originally published in single magazine form as The Vinyl Underground 6-12."

Summary (from OCLC): The Vinyl Underground is led by Morrison Shepherd, a D-list celebrity darling, soul DJ, and son of an ex-footballer. Fresh out of prison and off a nasty coke habit, Morrison is joined by a fellow ex-con named Perv, whose seizures give him clues to crimes long before the cops, and Leah, a gorgeous morgue assistant who leads a double life online and represents the brawn of the team. Morrison's ex-flame Abi is reluctantly forced to join the team when her father is implicated for murder. A young boy's head (with diamonds in the eye sockets) washes up on the edge of the Thames and seems to be connected to a series of ritual killings, a drug called Khat, and Muti magic. Can they get to the bottom of it?

323.heading: Sekulovic, Vesna.
323.title: Pinochet Ilustrado
323.author: Guillo ; direccion editorial, Francisco Mouat ; diseno grafico, Vesna Sekulovic.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): This book embodies the history of Chile during the dictatorship of Augusto Pinochet (1973-1990) and the authoritarian nature of this president. It's a collection of nearly three decades of Guillo's cartoons. The drawings, mostly featuring a character called "Little King" sits on a throne with dark glasses and golden crown directing the lives of Chileans. The book portrays the hardest times of the country and addresses the personality of the dictator in caricature-like fashion while hinting he craved the power of Louis XIV.
